author: headelf
title: C4S-Cardano4Seniors-Animation
description: Seniors need education about Defi, Cryptocurrency & Cardano with an Emphasis on Risk Management. How do we accomplish this - GLOBALLY?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very good and certainly fits the objectives of the challenge. The idea of ​​the proposal is to teach the elderly about our blockchain, in a way that is more adaptive to their learning process, certainly, explanations are provided for a young person who is already familiar with the technology and an elderly person who has never been exposed to Blockchain is very different. Having a program specifically designed to educate the elderly will most likely need to explain things at a different pace and with more detail than a great idea can have an impact. Big impact not only on the Cardano ecosystem but on the entire blockchain. This proposal has received funding from fund 8 and it has completed phase 1 (completed an educational language-ELI65 and started SM marketing). Back to this Fund 9, the proposed team wants to find funding to carry out phase 2, which is to create cartoon characters for this educational platform. I am very interested in this idea because visual education is a solution to help the elderly to be more interested in learning about a difficult-to-reach area. This proposal will create 4 animated characters with 4 different personalities, through their talks will animate the educational messages the proposal is aiming for and will then translate the conversations into multiple languages. There is clarity about the problem, the solution, and how they relate to the challenge. The proposal directly refers to the first objective of Fund 9's Strategic Goal which is "Prepare a group of people willing and able to contribute to the ecosystem"
f6_assessments.q1:
The feasibility of the project is good but some parts are not ideal in my opinion. First, about the roadmap, we are presented with what will happen each quarter, there are several activities listed. The concept of time per quarter is well described, but it would be nice to suggest dividing these tasks into monthly, and also better explaining who should be in charge of those tasks. Next comes the budget, the proposal asks for $35,000 and breaks it down into large chunks, each of which is broken down into smaller details. Here we are also provided with the hours for each stage as well as the total cost for each stage. So we know exactly what the money will be used for.
Finally, as far as the team is concerned, we are introduced to the team members Tom Frey, Theresa K, and Kevin Burke. Their area of ​​expertise is explained, however, it is not clear, we know their role in this proposal but it would be more convincing if their LinkedIn Profile is attached, where we can have more realistic examples of their past experiences. Therefore, I think the feasibility of the project is good, but it can still be improved.
f6_assessments.q2:
Project audibility is good, we have ways to track both the process and the result of this project. The proponent is very transparent in tracking the process of the project, the Team will use an Agile system to track and measure the progress of the project besides the proponent says that the task diagram will be generated will be available in the Miro tool; This tool is interesting because it allows videos, links, images, drawings, and text to be posted. In addition, the community can fully follow the project through Telegram channels, Discord and weekly updates will be published. Therefore, the progress of the period is audited.
The final successful outcome to mention is a series of 8+ PSA-type videos on YouTube translated into different languages ​​on Higher education using ELI65 with a focus on Risk Management. Can see that the success of the project is also clearly defined and consistent with the original roadmap and goals of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The need for senior education about Defi, Cryptocurrency & Cardano is undeniable. This is what the project is addressing by offering to create animated characters which will be used in Social media as educational videos.

The proposal takes into consideration the personality types and learning needs of seniors and the possibility for translation of the educational materials in many languages. The proposal is both linked to the Strategic Goals of Fund 9 - "Prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem" and the Challenge in this category - “Build real world solutions based on the Cardano blockchain”.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team states relevant experience to implement the project in the fields of Risk Manager, Tax & Investment, Cardano ecosystem and Art. I would like to see a deeper profe of their experience by links to CV, portfolio etc.

The milestones and timeline of the project are well described and detailed. The explanation of what “the 8 segments” are “a series of 8+ PSA type videos”, appears at the end of the proposal. This creates confusion when reading the proposal chronologically.

The description of the budget is a bit confusing at some lines. E.g. “8 hours X 6 x50hr. $ 2,400”. I am not sure what 6 means and what hr. means. Otherwise the budget is detailed and divided into separate costs and expenses.

The team is planning to offer a weekly updated newsletter to help track the progress of the project. They will also use Telegram and Discord to make the implementation transparent.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seeks to drive more uses to cardano by offering educational content to seniors through animated content. By teaching seniors how to navigate, and use the cryptospace, and the caradano space more specifically, they can make meaningful contributions and bring more traffic to the platform. I believe this proposal targeting seniors is very interesting for multiple reasons. Seniors are often left out of innovative spaces such as crypto, because there is a lack of educational content that is relatable, and catered to them. I believe there is an significant community of seniors that have a lot of ideas and a lot of interest for the cardano ecosystem, but lack the knowledge to enter it. Through animations that feature fun, familiar, well-liked characters, the author seeks to bring educational content to the older audience. I believe this proposal is very meaningful, and answers the challenge well.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe there are 3 major componentsthat will determine the success of this proposal. Firstly, the team that works on it. The team is comprised of seniors, to be able to understand the needs and the likes of their audiences, to be the most appealing possible. However, for an animation project, the author indicates that their animator might not be skilled enough to deliver the quality they want. This is very worrying, as the main workload is animation. I think they should seek a skilled animator as soon as possible. The team also seems to lack a technically knowledgeable member, such as a seasoned code developer or blockchain technology expert, to really be able to write educational content that is correct, easy to understand, and relevant. The second component that I would like to talk about is the content itself. There is not yet a clear script of what the content will be,or t the very least, the topics that will be touched upon. With the lack of a team member familiar and skilled in the crypto space, i worry about the quality of the content that will be put out. Finally, regarding the budget and timeline, I believe they are very reasonable and realistic, I hope they will be able to deliver according to the timeline. Taking into consideration the aforementioned elements, I am not completely confident about the success of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The progress is easily auditable by comparing their updates with the very detailed timeline given. As for success, the given platforms are sufficient to track how many people have been reached, through the comments, ratings and views on the animation videos. I believe it will be very easy to audit this project.
